title: UK SED Commitments
description: Uphold signatory commitments by actively promoting climate emergency awareness and sustainable design principles.
bullets: Engage with the Structural Sustainability Team for guidance on implementing UK SED principles
Embed sustainability thinking as a core consideration in all project planning and delivery decisions
Track progress through consistent application of sustainable design principles

title: Embodied Carbon Tracking
description: Track embodied carbon from early project stages and continue throughout project duration.
bullets: Track embodied carbon from RIBA 0/1 using appropriate tools (Eco.Zero suite where applicable, alternative methods for other structure types)
Implement systematic carbon assessment protocols for all structural projects
For projects above threshold value, conduct mandatory sustainability reviews with same rigour as calculation checks
Apply Eco.Zero tools where appropriate for early-stage optioneering and regular carbon tracking

title: Carbon Reduction
description: Actively pursue carbon reduction opportunities in all structural designs.
bullets: Optimise materials, structural systems, and lean design principles
Document carbon reduction strategies and achieved savings for each project
Share successful approaches through case studies and team knowledge sharing

title: Knowledge Sharing Platform
description: Engage with and contribute to sustainability knowledge sharing.
bullets: Regular SharePoint engagement including newsletters and technical resources
Contribute project experiences through case studies and technical insights
Organise or participate in lunchtime talks sharing interesting sustainability approaches
Collaborate with Structural Sustainability Team for guidance and innovation

title: Continuous Development
description: Stay current with sustainability developments and best practices.
bullets: Participate in training on sustainable design and carbon assessment
Attend external talks and events with IStructE and other professional bodies
Maintain awareness of industry sustainability developments
Seek feedback from Structural Sustainability Team on approaches

title: Foundational Sustainability Competency
description: Build core skills in carbon assessment and sustainable design principles.
bullets: Complete Eco.Zero tool training and demonstrate proficiency by Q2 FY26
Track embodied carbon on all assigned projects using appropriate methods from RIBA 0/1 onwards
Develop understanding of UK SED commitments through team engagement

title: Sustainable Design Integration
description: Support project teams in implementing sustainable design principles.
bullets: Conduct material efficiency reviews and carbon assessments using Eco.Zero tools
Participate in sustainability reviews, challenging assumptions and proposing alternatives
Attend external IStructE sustainability events and share learnings with team through presentations

title: Knowledge Sharing & Collaboration
description: Contribute to team knowledge and learning.
bullets: Author at least one SharePoint newsletter article by Q4 FY26
Participate in team sustainability discussions and seek mentorship
Present sustainability case studies from projects in lunchtime talks

title: Carbon Assessment Proficiency
description: Lead carbon assessments and tracking on assigned projects.
bullets: Lead carbon assessments achieving consistent tracking throughout design stages
Ensure comprehensive carbon documentation from RIBA 0/1 through construction
Identify minimum 3 carbon reduction opportunities per project by Q3 FY26

title: Advanced Sustainability Skills
description: Expand capability in circular design and emerging practices.
bullets: Develop expertise in existing structure assessment and material reuse strategies
Complete external CPD courses on embodied carbon assessment
Participate in industry forums and share insights through team presentations

title: Client Engagement Support
description: Support senior engineers in client sustainability presentations.
bullets: Prepare Eco.Zero optioneering studies demonstrating carbon and cost implications
Contribute to sustainability sections of proposals and bids
Track successful bid outcomes and client feedback

title: Project Sustainability Leadership
description: Take ownership of sustainability deliverables on multiple projects.
bullets: Embed UK SED principles achieving minimum 20% embodied carbon savings
Lead mandatory sustainability reviews with same rigour as calculation checks
Establish carbon baselines early (RIBA 0/1) and track performance through design stages

title: Team Capability Building
description: Mentor team members and lead knowledge sharing.
bullets: Mentor junior team members in sustainable design and Eco.Zero tools
Lead monthly sustainability discussions sharing project learnings
Organise quarterly lunchtime talks with internal and external speakers

title: Technical Excellence
description: Develop specialist expertise in low-carbon structural systems.
bullets: Research and apply low-carbon structural systems innovations
Complete advanced training in whole-life carbon assessment
Attend and present at external industry sustainability conferences

title: Sustainability Integration Leadership
description: Ensure comprehensive carbon tracking across project portfolio.
bullets: Achieve portfolio-wide 25% embodied carbon reductions by Q4 FY26
Champion early-stage intervention using Eco.Zero Optioneering from RIBA 0/1
Establish protocols ensuring sustainability treated with same rigour as calculations

title: Market Positioning
description: Lead client engagement on sustainability topics.
bullets: Present Eco.Zero capabilities at 3+ client events
Develop sustainability-focused service offerings
Advocate for mandatory sustainability reviews in client negotiations

title: Cultural Transformation
description: Drive team-wide adoption of sustainable design as standard practice.
bullets: Achieve 100% project compliance with carbon tracking requirements from RIBA 0/1
Establish regular engagement with Structural Sustainability Team
Create programme of external speaker events and sustainable project site visits

title: Technical Excellence & Innovation
description: Develop strategies to influence architectural proposals with low-carbon solutions.
bullets: Apply Eco.Zero tools to influence building briefs and material selection from RIBA 0/1
Champion circular design principles and existing asset reuse
Drive implementation of mandatory sustainability reviews for major projects

title: Strategic Client Partnerships
description: Establish partnerships to embed sustainability in client programmes.
bullets: Establish strategic partnerships with 3+ key clients by Q4 FY26
Develop value propositions quantifying carbon and cost benefits
Position sustainability reviews as essential project deliverable in fee proposals

title: Thought Leadership
description: Establish personal and AECOM brand as sustainability thought leaders.
bullets: Publish 2+ technical papers on structural sustainability by Q4 FY26
Present at national/international conferences on Eco.Zero applications
Participate in IStructE sustainability committees and share insights with team

title: Market Leadership
description: Position AECOM as market leader in structural sustainability.
bullets: Achieve 30% increase in sustainability-led project wins by Q4 FY26
Deliver client workshops showcasing Eco.Zero capabilities and carbon strategies
Establish sustainability review requirements in framework agreements

title: Organisational Transformation
description: Lead cultural shift towards embedded sustainability.
bullets: Establish sustainable design KPIs for all team members
Champion UK SED commitments through visible leadership and communication
Institute regular sustainability training including external speakers and site visits

title: Portfolio Excellence
description: Achieve portfolio-wide carbon reduction targets.
bullets: Achieve 30% embodied carbon reduction across portfolio by Q4 FY26
Establish QA protocols ensuring sustainability standards equal technical standards
Implement mandatory sustainability review gates with formal sign-off requirements

title: Strategic Market Positioning
description: Shape regional market through sustainability thought leadership.
bullets: Secure 3+ strategic partnerships focused on net-zero commitments by Q4 FY26
Lead industry collaboration on policy development and standards
Advocate at board level for mandatory sustainability reviews on all major projects

title: Sustainability Leadership Culture
description: Embed sustainability as core organisational value.
bullets: Establish sustainability as top-3 organisational priority through cultural assessment
Invest in tools, training, and thought leadership for market differentiation
Create comprehensive professional development pathway including external qualifications

title: Excellence Standards
description: Set ambitious regional targets for embodied carbon reduction.
bullets: Demonstrate leadership through published results and industry case studies
Establish AECOM as exemplar for sustainable structural engineering practice
Ensure sustainability carries equal weight in all project governance and reviews

title: Technical Skills Development
description: Build competency in sustainability tools and carbon assessment.
bullets: Develop proficiency in Eco.Zero Measure for Revit data extraction by Q3 FY26
Build competency in sustainable material specifications and carbon factors
Support comprehensive carbon tracking documentation from early stages through construction

title: Sustainability Integration
description: Support engineering teams in carbon assessment deliverables.
bullets: Maintain accurate model data and generate regular carbon reports using Eco.Zero Measure
Contribute to material efficiency studies through detailed quantity take-offs
Participate in project sustainability reviews providing technical input

title: Knowledge Contribution
description: Share technical insights on sustainable construction methods.
bullets: Contribute to team knowledge base through SharePoint articles or technical notes
Participate in sustainability training to enhance understanding of carbon principles
Attend external technical seminars and share practical insights with team
